contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox River | river_name = Terek River | image_name =TerekRiver NorthGeorgia.jpg | caption =Terek River in North [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] | origin = [[Zilgakhokh]], [[Kazbek]], [[Caucasus Major]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] | mouth = [[Caspian Sea]] {{coord|43.595278|47.561667|display=it}} | basin_countries = [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]; [[North Ossetia]], [[Kabardino-Balkaria]], [[Stavropol Krai]], [[Chechnya]] and [[Dagestan]], Russia | length = {{Convert|623|km|mi|abbr=on}} | elevation = {{Convert|5037|m|ft|abbr=on}} | mouth_elevation = {{Convert|-28|m|ft|abbr=on}} | discharge = {{Convert|305|m3|abbr=on}} per second | watershed = {{Convert|43200|km2|mi2|abbr=on}} }} [[File:View of Vladikavkaz.jpg|thumb|right|300px|The Terek river in [[Vladikavkaz]]]] [[File:Mountain Zilgi-Khokh and source of River Terek (A).jpg|thumb|left|Mountain Zilgi-Khokh and source of River Terek in 1886.]] The '''Terek River''' ({{Lang-rus|Те́рек|p=ˈtʲerʲɪk}}; {{Lang-ka|თერგი}}, {{Lang|ka-Latn|''Tergi''}}; {{Lang-os|Терк}}, {{Lang-av| Терек}}, {{Lang|av-Latn|''Terek''}}, {{Lang-ce|Теркa}}, {{Lang|ce-Latn|''Terka''}}) is a major river in the [[Northern Caucasus]], flowing through [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] and Russia into the [[Caspian Sea]]. It rises in Georgia near the juncture of the [[Caucasus Mountains|The Greater Caucasus Mountain Range]] and the [[Khokh Range]], to the southwest of [[Mount Kazbek]], winding north in a white torrent between the town of Stephantsminda and the village of Gergeti [1] toward the Russian region [[North Ossetia]] and the city of [[Vladikavkaz]]. It turns east to flow through [[Chechnya]] and [[Dagestan]] before [[Water divide|dividing into two branches]] which empty into the [[Caspian Sea]]. Below the city of [[Kizlyar]] it forms a swampy [[river delta]] around {{Convert|100|km|mi|abbr=on}} wide. Major inflows are [[Gizeldon]], [[Ardon River|Ardon]], [[Urukh]], [[Fiagdon]], [[Malka River|Malka]], [[Baksan River|Baksan]] and [[Sunzha]] rivers. The river is a key natural asset in the region, being used for [[irrigation]] and [[hydroelectric power]] in its upper reaches. The main cities on the Terek are [[Vladikavkaz]], [[Mozdok, Republic of North Ossetia–Alania|Mozdok]], and [[Kizlyar]]. Several minor [[hydroelectrostation]] are constructed on Terek: [[Dzau electrostation]] (in Vladikavkaz), Bekanskaya and Pavlodolskaya. ==Human history== The capital of [[Khazaria]] [[Samandar (city)|Samandar]] was possibly placed at the bank of the river. The Terek river was the site of the final defeat of the [[Hulagu]], [[Khan (title)|khan]] of the [[Ilkhanate]], Army, against the army of [[Berke]], khan of the [[Golden Horde]], led by [[Nogai Khan]], in the first civil war of the [[Mongol Empire]], the [[Berke–Hulagu war]]. Also is the site of a battle that [[Battle of the Terek River|Timur defeated Tokhtamysh]] in 1395.
